# disableDepthOfField

**Type Property**

Disable the depth of field effect for all virtual content.

## Declaration

```swift
static let disableDepthOfField: ARView.RenderOptions
```

## Discussion

When you set the focal point of a camera, you actually choose a range of focus rather than a point. Objects outside the range — either too close or too far away — appear out of focus, while objects inside the range appear in focus. The size of the range, known as the depth of field, depends on characteristics of the lens, the focal point, and other factors.



If you place a virtual object outside of the range of focus, it can appear detached from the scene in which it appears unless you blur the object to match its surroundings. In many cases, the depth of field is large enough that this doesn’t matter. But if it does matter for your app, you can enable a post-processing effect that blurs virtual objects to account for depth of field.



Because of its computational cost, the system disables depth of field by default when you create a new [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView] instance. To enable depth of field, remove the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/RenderOptions-swift.struct/disableDepthOfField] option from the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/renderOptions-swift.property] set. If you do enable depth of field, be sure to check your app’s performance, as described in [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/improving-the-performance-of-a-realitykit-app].

## Disabling rendering effects

- **disableCameraGrain**: Disable the image noise effect.
- **disableHDR**: Disable the high dynamic range post-processing effect.
- **disableGroundingShadows**: Disable rendering of ambient occlusion and shadows that ground objects in an AR scene.
- **disableMotionBlur**: Disable the motion blur for all virtual content.
- **disableFaceMesh**: Disable generation of the face entity with the default occlusion material.
- **disablePersonOcclusion**: Disable person segmentation.
- **disableAREnvironmentLighting**: Disable lighting from environment probes.
- **disableFaceOcclusions**: Disable automatic face occlusion.
- **disableAutomaticLighting**: Disable automatic updates of the scene lighting.
